tool.name: GenerateRouteIdAndDotId

param.name: sde_filepath
param.dialogReference: SDE filepath pointing to the correct ELRS database that has been set up with the proper sequences to generate a new ROUTE_ID or DOT_ID.

param.name: route_id_flag
param.dialogReference: If checked, a new ROUTE_ID will be generated.

param.name: dot_id_flag
param.dialogReference: If checked, a new DOT_ID will be generated.

tool.summary: New ROUTE_IDs and DOT_IDs in the NYSDOT ELRS are generated using a database sequence on the ELRS database. This tool looks in the "Database Connections" folder of your ArcCatalog for an SDE connection file called "dev_ad_lockroot.sde" or "dev_ad_Lockroot.sde" and prepopulates the input parameters if it's found. The tool then connects to the database and generates a new ROUTE_ID or DOT_ID, depending on which options are specified.
tool.usage:
• Connects to the ELRS Development database by default if one of two filenames are present: "dev_ad_lockroot.sde" or "dev_ad_Lockroot.sde".

  • The SDE Filepath parameter must be an SDE file that points to the correct ELRS database.

  • The Get a New ROUTE_ID and Get a New DOT_ID parameters are both optional. If a checkmark is present, a new ROUTE_ID or DOT_ID will be generated respectively.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: New ROUTE_IDs and DOT_IDs in the NYSDOT ELRS are generated using a database sequence on the ELRS database. This tool looks in the "Database Connections" folder of your ArcCatalog for an SDE connection file called "dev_ad_lockroot.sde" or "dev_ad_Lockroot.sde" and prepopulates the input parameters if it's found. The tool then connects to the database and generates a new ROUTE_ID or DOT_ID, depending on which options are specified.
